discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Prime Collaboration needs only SNMP read access to collect network device information. SNMP must also be enabled on network devices to allow Prime Collaboration to get information on network devices at configured polling intervals and to receive alerts and faults via trap notification sent by the managed devices.
CCNP and CCIE Collaboration Core CLCOR 350-801 Official Cert Guide
Chapter 14: DNS, NTP, and SNMP

The correct answer is:

C. SNMP

Cisco Prime Collaboration Manager uses SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) to receive alerts and faults via traps from devices at regular polling intervals. SNMP is widely used for network management and monitoring, and it allows Cisco devices to send trap notifications to management systems like Cisco Prime.

questions.question_text: Cisco Prime Collaboration Manager is using Cisco Discovery Protocol to discover devices in an automated setup. What must be used to get alerts and faults via traps from the devices at regular polling intervals?
Configuration of DNS is required to achieve a fully functional Cisco UCM system. Cisco UCM uses DNS to resolve fully qualified domain names to IP addresses for which destinations?

discussion.content:
Correct me if im wrong. MRA isn't a "destination", more of a concept to enable remote workers to connect to the enterprise and use the collab features provided by CUCM.

Ill go with B.

Selected Answer: B
MRA isn't part of a fully functioning UCM system...

Unified CM can use DNS to: 
- Resolve service (SRV) records to host names and then to IP addresses for SIP trunk destinations
- Resolve service (SRV) records to host names and then to IP addresses for SIP trunk destinations 

https://community.cisco.com/t5/ip-telephony-and-phones/2-part-question-regarding-dns-on-cucm/td-p/2256179

comments.content:
there is no MRA configuration on CUCM.
you may only need a trunk to VCS for B2b calls, but not for MRA

discussion.content: definitely MRA. trunk can be configured with their IP

choices.A:
Switch(config)# interface gigabitethernet2/0/1
Switch(config-if)# qos trust device desk-phone
choices.B:
Switch(config)# interface gigabitethernet2/0/1
Switch(config-if)# qos mis trust device cisco-phone
choices.C:
Switch(config)# interface gigabitethernet2/0/1
Switch(config-if)# mis trust qos device desk-phone
choices.D:
Switch(config)# interface gigabitethernet2/0/1
Switch(config-if)# mis qos trust device cisco-phone

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
mls qos trust device cisco-phone would be the only command accepted on the interface of a SW

mls qos trust device cisco-phone

Answer: D

Selected Answer: D
There's a typo in D (it has "mis" instead of "mls"), but it's otherwise correct.

Selected Answer: D
It seems to be D
https://community.cisco.com/t5/switching/mls-qos-trust-cos-and-device-cisco-phone/td-p/1311619

questions.question_text: Which set of QoS commands must be configured on an interface of a catalyst switch so the ingress traffic can be trusted for a desk phone?

choices.C: The option "DSCP for Video" sets the DSCP value for all types of video to the same value.
choices.D: Configure the clusterwide QoS parameters in the Cisco CallManager Service Parameter section on any nodes within the Cisco UCM cluster.
choices.B:
Audio calls and the audio portion of video calls are tagged with DSCP value 46.
B. Configure the clusterwide QoS parameters in the Enterprise Parameter section on the Cisco UCM publisher.
choices.A: Have the option to set the DSCP values for "video calls", "audio portion of the video calls", and "immediate video calls" separately.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
B. is not advisable, since video calls and it audio portion must be set up at the same DiffServ, 34. They can not be set to 46.
C. is incorrect. Clusterwide QoS parameter does not exist in Enterprise Parameters.
D. is incorrect. DSCP for video applies for CUCM desktop endpoints and softphones.

A and E are correct. They exist in Service Parameters.

Selected Answer: AD
I don't know why it has two options for B...

A is correct and what is currently listed as D (which SHOULD be "E") is also correct.

Selected Answer: AD
It should be A and "E". You can configure clusterwide DSCP under Serviceparameters.

questions.question_text: An engineer must help a customerâ€™s administrator to set QoS options for the cluster. What are two QoS settings on the Cisco UCM server? (Choose two.)

An engineer must deploy the Cisco Webex app to a shared Windows Virtual Desktop Infrastructure environment in the C:\Program Files folder. Which command line argument must be run when running the installer?

discussion.content:
ALLUSERS=1 
Installs Webex App in c:\program files. This is useful in a shared environment (typically non-persistent VDI).

This is a mandatory argument for installation. VDI must be installed per HVD. Per user installation is not supported yet.
